hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Safina, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: He got separated from the army in the land of Rome, or was captured, so he fled searching for the army. Then behold, he encountered a lion. He said to it: "O Abu al-Harith (O father of death), I am the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and my situation is thus and thus." So the lion approached him with its tongue hanging out until it stood beside him. Whenever it heard a sound, it came to him, then it went back to walking beside him until he reached the army, then the lion returned.

narrators.name: Said ibn Abd al-Rahman
narrators.full_name: Said ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Yahya al-Jahshi

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn al-Munkadir

Topics: Incident of Safina separated from the army in Roman lands
Encounter with a lion
Miracle of the lion protecting and guiding the freed slave of Prophet ﷺ

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Harithah ibn al-Nu'man: I passed by the Messenger of Allah ﷺ while Gabriel was sitting with him in the gatherings. I greeted him, then I left. When I returned and the Prophet ﷺ had turned away, he said to me: "Did you see the one who was with me?" I said: "Yes." He said: "That was Gabriel, and he has returned your greeting."

narrators.name: Al-Zuhri
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Muslim ibn Shihab al-Zuhri
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From (but al-Zuhri is known as mudallis so this requires scrutiny)

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Aamir ibn Rabi'ah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Aamir ibn Rabi'ah al-Ansari

narrators.name: Harithah ibn al-Nu'man

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Al-Zuhri is known for mudallis (Category 2) - he uses 'an (عَنْ) but is generally reliable even with this term. Abdullah ibn Aamir uses direct transmission term أَخْبَرَنِي which strengthens the chain.

potential_issues.issue: Al-Zuhri (Ibn Shihab) is classified as a mudallis of Category 2 and uses 'an (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: While al-Zuhri is a highly reliable narrator and Category 2 mudallis are generally accepted even with indirect transmission terms, this transmission method introduces slight potential ambiguity. However, this is not significant given al-Zuhri's overall reliability and the direct transmission term from Abdullah ibn Aamir ibn Rabi'ah who uses أَخْبَرَنِي. The chain remains sound.

Topics: Incident of Harithah ibn al-Nu'man encountering Angel Gabriel
Gabriel returning the greetings of the believer
Unseen realities and manifestation of angels

hadiths.english_translation: [This is a chapter heading only - not a hadith text]

Narrated by Mu'adh ibn Jabal: I was riding behind the Prophet ﷺ (on the same mount) when he said: "Do you know, O Mu'adh, what is the right of Allah upon the people?" I said: "Allah and His Messenger know best." He said: "His right upon them is that they worship Him and do not associate anything with Him. Do you know, O Mu'adh, what is the right of the people upon Allah if they do that?" I said: "Allah and His Messenger know best." He said: "Verily the right of the people upon Allah is that He does not punish them." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, shall I not give glad tidings to the people?" He said: "Leave them to do deeds."

narrators.name: Abu Ishaq
narrators.full_name: Amr ibn Abdullah ibn Uthman al-Hamdani
reliabilityIssues: mixed memory - attributed with mistakes in some narrations
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From (direct transmission but with reliability concerns)

narrators.name: Amr ibn Maymun

chainIssues: Abu Ishaq (Amr ibn Abdullah al-Hamdani) is graded as Saduq Yahim meaning he had memory issues and made errors in some narrations. This affects the reliability of the chain.

potential_issues.issue: Abu Ishaq (Amr ibn Abdullah al-Hamdani) is graded as Saduq Yahim - a truthful narrator but with memory errors in some narrations
potential_issues.impact: This narrator's reliability concerns reduce the overall chain quality from Perfect to lower grades. Abu Ishaq is known to have confused some narrations despite being truthful in intent. This is a significant reliability issue that affects the hadith's grade.

Topics: Dialogue between Prophet ﷺ and Mu'adh ibn Jabal
The right of Allah upon people to worship Him alone
The right of people upon Allah not to punish the believers
Prohibition of publicizing glad tidings before action

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: I was walking with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ in a field of some people of Madinah when he said: "O Abu Hurayrah, the extravagant ones have perished except those who said 'thus and thus', and they are few." Then he walked for a while and said: "O Abu Hurayrah, shall I not show you a treasure of the treasures of Paradise?" I said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "You should say: 'There is no power and no might except with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great, and there is no refuge from Allah except to Him.'" Then he walked for a while and said: "O Abu Hurayrah, do you know what is the right of Allah upon the people and what is the right of the people upon Allah?" I said: "Allah and His Messenger know best." He said: "The right of Allah upon the people is that they worship Him and do not associate anything with Him. When they do that, then the right upon Allah is that He does not punish them."

narrators.name: Abu Ishaq
narrators.full_name: Amr ibn Abdullah ibn Uthman al-Hamdani

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "A man was excessive in his sins. When death approached him, he commanded his sons saying: 'When I die, burn me, then grind my ashes, then scatter me in the wind over the sea. By Allah, if my Lord gains power over me, He will certainly punish me with a punishment that He has not punished anyone.' He said (or he said): 'Your fear (of Allah)' or he said: 'Your punishment, O Lord,' so Allah forgave him because of that."

narrators.name: Al-Zuhri
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Muslim ibn Shihab al-Zuhri
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From (but al-Zuhri is known as mudallis so this requires scrutiny)

narrators.name: Humaid ibn Abd al-Rahman
narrators.full_name: Humaid ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Aws al-Himyari

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

chainIssues: Al-Zuhri is known for mudallis (Category 2) - he uses 'an (عَنْ) but is generally reliable. Humaid ibn Abd al-Rahman uses direct transmission term أَخْبَرَنِي which strengthens the chain.

potential_issues.issue: Al-Zuhri is a Category 2 mudallis using 'an (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: Al-Zuhri is highly reliable despite being a mudallis, and Category 2 mudallis are generally accepted even with indirect transmission terms. The direct transmission from Humaid ibn Abd al-Rahman (using أَخْبَرَنِي) provides additional strength to the chain. This is not a significant reliability concern.

Topics: Incident of a man repenting from excessive sins before death
Testament about cremation and scattering ashes
Trust in Allah's mercy through fear and shame before Allah
Divine forgiveness for the fearful sinner

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "A woman entered the Hellfire because of a cat which she had tied up. She neither fed it nor released it to eat from the insects of the earth until it died." Al-Zuhri said: "This is so that neither does a person rely (completely) on his deeds nor despair."

narrators.name: Al-Zuhri
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Muslim ibn Shihab al-Zuhri

narrators.name: Humaid ibn Abd al-Rahman

chainIssues: Al-Zuhri is a Category 2 mudallis but uses direct transmission term قَالَ. The chain is otherwise strong with direct transmission throughout.

potential_issues.impact: While al-Zuhri is highly reliable and Category 2 mudallis are accepted, his status as a mudallis should be noted. However, the use of direct transmission term قَالَ indicates he heard this. The overall chain strength is good.

Topics: Incident of a woman entering Hellfire for cruelty to a cat
Punishment for animal cruelty and neglect
Balance between reliance on deeds and fear of punishment

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Masud: There were two villages, one righteous and one unjust. A man left the unjust village intending to go to the righteous village, but death came to him as Allah willed. The angel and Satan disputed over him. Satan said: "By Allah, he never disobeyed me." The angel said: "He has left intending repentance." They judged between them that they should look at which of the two villages was closer, and they found him closer to the righteous village by a span (handwidth), so he was forgiven." Ma'mar said: "And I heard someone say: 'Allah brought the righteous village closer to him.'"

narrators.full_name: Amr ibn Abdullah ibn Uthman al-Hamdani
reliabilityIssues: mixed memory - made errors in some narrations

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Hammad (who) heard Abu Hurayrah saying: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "A woman entered the Hellfire because of a cat, or a tomcat, which she tied up. She neither fed it nor released it to scratch (gnaw) from the insects of the earth until it died of hunger."

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Mu'adh ibn Jabal: When death approached him, people said to him: "We see you being overtaken (by death), so advise us." He said: "I myself see only that I am being overtaken, and this is a bad time for lying. Know that whoever dies while believing in three things with certainty: that Allah is his Lord, that the Hour is coming with no doubt in it, and that Allah resurrects those in the graves." Ibn Sireen said: "Either he (Mu'adh) said: he will enter Paradise, or he said: he will escape from the Fire."

narrators.name: Ayub
narrators.full_name: Ayub ibn Abu Tamimah al-Sakhtiyani

narrators.name: Ibn Sireen

chainIssues: Abu al-Daylam is majhul al-hal (his reliability not documented by scholars). This creates a reliability concern in an otherwise strong chain.

potential_issues.issue: Abu al-Daylam is majhul al-hal - his reliability status is undocumented
potential_issues.impact: This narrator's unknown reliability status affects the hadith's grading. While the rest of the chain is strong (Ayub and Ibn Sireen are both Thiqah Thabt), the presence of a majhul al-hal narrator reduces the overall authenticity from Perfect.

Topics: Incident of Mu'adh ibn Jabal's approaching death
Testament regarding belief in three core Islamic principles
Guarantee of Paradise and salvation for the believer

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Qatadah: (It was reported that) Ibn Umar was asked about (the phrase) "There is no god except Allah." Does any deed harm (together with its affirmation) as (the affirmation of) no deed benefits (without) its affirmation? Ibn Umar said: "Live (on) and do not be deceived."

narrators.name: Qatadah
narrators.full_name: Qatadah ibn Diarah al-Sadusi
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From (but Qatadah is known as mudallis Category 3)

narrators.name: Ibn Umar
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Umar ibn al-Khattab

chainIssues: Qatadah is a Category 3 mudallis and uses 'an (عَنْ), which is problematic for his narrations. Careful evaluation needed.

potential_issues.issue: Qatadah is a Category 3 mudallis using indirect transmission term 'an (عَنْ)
potential_issues.impact: Qatadah is classified as a Category 3 mudallis, and his use of 'an creates ambiguity about direct transmission. This requires direct transmission terms for acceptance. Additionally, this is a mawquf (statement of Companion), not a marfu' hadith. The reliability concern affects this transmission significantly.

Topics: Dialogue about the significance of the Shahada (declaration of faith)
Relationship between profession of faith and righteous deeds
Statement of Ibn Umar about not being deceived

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Al-Zuhri: When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ died, some of his companions almost experienced whispers (doubts). Uthman was one of those who experienced this. Umar passed by him and he did not respond. Umar went to Abu Bakr and said: "Do you not see Uthman? I passed by him and greeted him but he did not return my greeting." He said: "Let us go to him." So they both passed by him and greeted him, and he returned their greeting. Abu Bakr said to him: "What is the matter with you? Your brother passed by you just now and greeted you but you did not return his greeting." He said: "I did not do that." Umar said: "Yes, you did! But this is arrogance with you, O Banu Umayyah!" Abu Bakr said: "Yes, you did it, but something distracted you from it." He said: "I was remembering the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and remembering that Allah took him away before we asked him about the salvation of this matter (the Caliphate)." Abu Bakr said: "I asked him about that." Uthman said: "May my father and mother be ransomed for you! You are more deserving of that." Abu Bakr said: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what is the salvation of this matter that we are in?' He said: 'Whoever accepts the word that I presented to my uncle and he rejected it, that word will be salvation for him.'"

narrators.name: Al-Zuhri
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Muslim ibn Shihab al-Zuhri
narrators.transmissionTermMeaning: From (but al-Zuhri is a Category 2 mudallis)

The presence of Abu Bakr al-Siddiq as an intermediary (as a Companion reporting from the Prophet ﷺ) strengthens the chain. The hadith quality is sound despite the mudallis status.

Interaction between Umar and Uthman about his behavior

The word (Shahada) offered to Abu Lahab as salvation
